forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 5. Wind chill values as low as -2. Northwest wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow after 9am. Cloudy. High near 29, with temperatures falling to around 16 in the afternoon. Wind chill values as low as 0. North wind 3 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of 3 to 7 inches possible.

weather_report:
As the chill of the night sets in over Boston, a surreal blanket of clouds cloaks the city, whispering tales of an impending snow. The air carries the distinct bite of winter, dipping to a cool 5 degrees, further intensified by wind chill factors that tease the imagination with visions of ice. The night is draped in darkness, punctuated only by the distant twinkle of city lights—each one a tiny beacon amid the enveloping shadows. 

Tomorrow promises to be an evocative mix as snow begins to fall gracefully after the morning light, transforming the gray landscape into a delicate tapestry of white. With high temperatures barely crawling to 29, and a chill that lingers, it is wise to don layers—a cozy sweater beneath a sturdy winter coat, perhaps topped with a wool hat and a scarf wrapped closely. The air will feel crisp, and while the snow may inhibit certain outings, there is a comforting beauty in the whitened streets. Far from merely an inconvenience, the snowfall invites one to sip a warm cup at a local café or meander through the serene parks, where the world pauses to breathe under its frosty embrace.
